turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: This is yours...

turns.speaker: STAR MAN
turns.text: If you want to keep it, you can.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: I'd like to...

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Would you put some of your singing in this for the baby?

turns.speaker: STAR MAN
turns.text: You want the baby to laugh at me.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: How long will it take you to get home?

turns.speaker: STAR MAN
turns.text: Many, many days and nights...

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: I'm sure we could find a country and western station.

turns.speaker: STAR MAN
turns.text: No, thank you.

turns.speaker: STAR MAN
turns.text: There.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: STAR MAN
turns.text: The yellow one.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Oh, wow... I'll tell you what. When the baby is born, we'll go out in my back yard and wave to you.

turns.speaker: STAR MAN
turns.text: I will wave to you.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Where do you think you're going?

turns.speaker: STAR MAN
turns.text: Thank you, Jennyhaydn. You are good. I must go alone now.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: I said I would get you to your ship and that's where we're going to say goodbye.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Well...

turns.speaker: STAR MAN
turns.text: I must go.

turns.speaker: STAR MAN
turns.text: What do I do now?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: You say you love me and kiss me 'goodbye.'

turns.speaker: STAR MAN
turns.text: I love you.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: I'm never going to see you again, am I?

turns.speaker: STAR MAN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: STAR MAN
turns.text: Tell the baby about me.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: I will.

turns.speaker: STAR MAN
turns.text: Goodbye.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Help me!!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: You could have killed us both!!

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: He's kidnapping me!!!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Jesus Christ!! You crazy people...

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Call the police!!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Hey buddy... let her go...

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Help me!!!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Hey, she doesn't want to go with you. Come on.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Oh God, man... don't shoot me... My mistake... I'm sorry...

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: He doesn't understand... just walk away...

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: You sure this is your car?

turns.speaker: TEENAGER
turns.text: My grandmother's rich.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Slow down, slow down.

turns.speaker: TEENAGER
turns.text: Geez, Mrs. Haydn, we just got going.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: I told you I'm looking for someone.

turns.speaker: TEENAGER
turns.text: In the cars, too?!

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: I don't know where he is.

turns.speaker: TEENAGER
turns.text: This is going to be a real drag. I thought you wanted to go fast.

turns.speaker: TEENAGER
turns.text: They after you?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: What? No, of course not.

turns.speaker: TEENAGER
turns.text: Would be kinda neat if they were. I think I could outrun them. Maybe get my picture in the papers.

turns.speaker: TEENAGER
turns.text: I'm telling you, you're going to find him at the roadblock, or right after, or not at all.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: If he didn't want to go through the roadblock, is there any other way to get to Vegas?

turns.speaker: TEENAGER
turns.text: Fly.

turns.speaker: TEENAGER
turns.text: The five-fifty. We already passed it. But it'll take him way out of his way.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Pull over. I've got to get back there.

turns.speaker: TEENAGER
turns.text: Why wouldn't he want to go through the roadblock?... What did you guys do?... I won't tell anybody.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: It's easier not to tell if you don't know.

turns.speaker: TEENAGER
turns.text: Wait. Could I have your autograph?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: TEENAGER
turns.text: I have nothing to do. I'd like to help you.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Don't worry. I'll be all right.

turns.speaker: LYMAN
turns.text: Is it for real?

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: Get Fox.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: Aghh... I'm supposed to umpire a little league game tomorrow.

turns.speaker: LYMAN
turns.text: I wouldn't worry about it... There might not be any little league tomorrow.

turns.speaker: LYMAN
turns.text: This is crazy. What were we going to do if that had been the ship? We have two thirty calibre machine guns, three M16's and some handguns.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: Give it a rest, Lyman.

turns.speaker: LYMAN
turns.text: That's because the ones that were hurt, died. They couldn't talk to you.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: Any reports about monsters, people in Halloween masks, anything like that?

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: Good... It looks like we might be the welcoming committee, so I think we should try and figure out what we're gonna do if we have to come face to face with this creature.

turns.speaker: LYMAN
turns.text: Bell wants us to get down on our knees and bow.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: Did your people have any contingencies rehearsed?

turns.speaker: LYMAN
turns.text: I know. She bought him a ticket for Lathrop Wells and put him on the bus. He didn't stay on though and they drove off together.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: Doesn't make sense.

turns.speaker: LYMAN
turns.text: Maybe he's turned her into one of them. They enter the crowd around the helicopter.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: Tell him I'm not here.

turns.speaker: LYMAN
turns.text: I did.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: You get that, Lyman?

turns.speaker: LYMAN
turns.text: We're ready.

turns.speaker: MAJOR BELL
turns.text: I'm telling you they're probably friendly.

turns.speaker: LYMAN
turns.text: Then why did they try and sneak in the back door? Tell me that. Why didn't they contact us first and say...

turns.speaker: MAJOR BELL
turns.text: They're gonna let some local cop blow him away.

turns.speaker: LYMAN
turns.text: Save us all a lot of trouble.

turns.speaker: MAJOR BELL
turns.text: Jesus Lyman, you're an ignorant fool.

turns.speaker: LYMAN
turns.text: Bullshit!

turns.speaker: MAJOR BELL
turns.text: You have no conception of this, do you?

turns.speaker: LYMAN
turns.text: You jerk! You look at all the sweetness and light and goodness you think'll come out of this. You know what's gonna come out of this... The end of religion, the end of civilization, the end of the earth. We could become slaves, we could become a colony of these things. Don't you see that? Are you too stupid to see that?

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: This has always been my favorite time of day.

turns.speaker: MAJOR BELL
turns.text: Very beautiful country up here...

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: Any signs of biological contamination, excessive radiation, anything like that?

turns.speaker: MAJOR BELL
turns.text: Not on the landscape. We're trying to get a tube under the faceplate for a reading on possible deadly lifeforms but it's hard going.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: Can you see under the faceplate?

turns.speaker: MAJOR BELL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: There's a good chance you could be wrong about this thing then...

turns.speaker: MAJOR BELL
turns.text: Wait'll you see it.

turns.speaker: MAJOR BELL
turns.text: We had a flight of F16's play tag with the spaceship over Michigan for an hour. Then it shot straight up and disappeared.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: Was there visual contact?

turns.speaker: MAJOR BELL
turns.text: No, sir. Radar.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: It could have been anything.

turns.speaker: MAJOR BELL
turns.text: After I called in, I had a chance to sit down with the three locals. They swear there's another one that didn't make the ship... It might be alive.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: People have made mistakes in these situations before.

turns.speaker: MAJOR BELL
turns.text: I've been investigating sightings for seventeen years, Mr. Shermin. This one's real. We have a dead extra- terrestrial in that tent and another one in the area that might be alive. We've been visited. It's finally happened and the sooner Washington accepts that and starts figuring out how we're going to deal with these beings, the better off we're going to be.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: Oh, Jesus.

turns.speaker: MAJOR BELL
turns.text: We better get it into the box. Come on...

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: There's nothing... No reports of sightings or landings or anything... in the other parts of the country or overseas... Seems like a totally isolated incident.

turns.speaker: MAJOR BELL
turns.text: It was only an accident that we discovered them.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: I know, but...

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: You married, Major?

turns.speaker: MAJOR BELL
turns.text: Twenty-eight years.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: To the same woman?

turns.speaker: MAJOR BELL
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: I tried it once... Fourteen years ago... 'I was a lousy husband and a worse father. The only thing I'm good at is this... At least until yesterday.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: How would you describe the sounds we heard coming out of that thing's helmet?

turns.speaker: MAJOR BELL
turns.text: It was kind of like clicking, maybe a language wasn't it?

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: Listen to this.  A woman was kidnapped in Eau Claire this morning. When a citizen went to her rescue the kidnapper threatened him with a gun and shouted at him in a strange 'clicking gibberish'...

turns.speaker: MAJOR BELL
turns.text: It was a man though... right?

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: The police think he was high on drugs...

turns.speaker: MAJOR BELL
turns.text: Nothing up there... The grass is matted down in a few places, but that could have been anything.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: It was the husband. The police finally got a hold of the witness at work and showed him a picture of the woman.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: STAR MAN
turns.text: Las Vegas, please. I do not speak English.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Hop in.

turns.speaker: STAR MAN
turns.text: I don't understand.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Parlez vous Francais?... Habla Ingles?... Sprechen zie deutsch?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Good job, neither do I. What do you do for a living?

turns.speaker: STAR MAN
turns.text: I don't understand.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I'm a cook. Do you understand 'cook?'

turns.speaker: STAR MAN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: I told you...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Judy, that's stupid.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Well, maybe these men won't think so. We were asleep when a helicopter woke me up. It made me so nervous I went into the kitchen for something to eat. I happened to look out the window and there was Scott Haydn with this green thing draped over his arm pulling Jenny down the walk to the car.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: You know that's impossible!

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: I know what I saw. I've seen him enough times.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Scott Haydn is dead. He died about three months ago. We went to the funeral.

turns.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
turns.text: Is there a reward in this?

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: Huh?... Eh... no, there isn't

turns.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
turns.text: Because I'm the one who called the police, you know.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: Yeah, thanks. We appreciate that.

turns.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
turns.text: Hey, it's none of my business why you're chasing a retard... You want my opinion, it's the girl. She had to hold the guy's hand all the way to the car like he was a kid.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: You saw that?

turns.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
turns.text: Hey... he didn't look like no big time criminal to me.

turns.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
turns.text: Eh... the store tells you to call when there's trouble, so they won't get sued... But that shouldn't matter if there's a reward, right?

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: I wouldn't think so.

turns.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
turns.text: That's what I thought. So remember it was me because sometimes rewards come late, you know.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: We will.  Something's wrong here. She's helping him now.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: Hello...

turns.speaker: STAR MAN
turns.text: I must get to my ship, Mr. Shermin.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: We can't let you do that.

turns.speaker: STAR MAN
turns.text: I don't want to hurt anybody. I just want to go home.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: All the roads into Death Valley are blocked. We'd like to talk to you.

turns.speaker: STAR MAN
turns.text: If I talk to you, I will miss my ship.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: Hold on a minute... Let's take the chance, George.

turns.speaker: BEEMER
turns.text: Yeah, that's right.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: I saw you play, man.  You were good. Like a fucking freight train I remember saying.  So what happened, injuries or what?

turns.speaker: BEEMER
turns.text: Bullshit politics.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: It's always politics.  Like this thing we're in here, he's paying you to tune me up, right?  But I could pay you more not to.  See what I mean?  I could write you a check right now--

turns.speaker: BEEMER
turns.text: Come on, let's go, I got to get back.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Okay cash!  Logical.  Here's everything I have on me, what do you say?  How about a Rolex?

turns.speaker: BEEMER
turns.text: I already got a real one.  Come on, it won't be too bad.  It's not personal.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Just not the eyes.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Okay, let's get you wired up.  I hope this axle grease you got in your hair doesn't screw up the squid receptors.

turns.speaker: EDUARDO
turns.text: What's all this squid shit?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Superconducting QUantum Interference Device.  SQUID.  Got it?  There's gonna be a test.

turns.speaker: EDUARDO
turns.text: Hey, fuck you, man.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Easy, Eduardo, easy.  Preserve a sense of humor at all times.  Okay, the receptor rig... what I'm putting on your head... sends a signal to the recorder.  See we call it "being wired," but there's no wire.  You gotta keep the recorder close... five, six feet away max, like in your jacket pocket by the bed or wherever you're going to close escrow, know what I mean?

turns.speaker: EDUARDO
turns.text: Yeah, right.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Some tips.  Don't dart your eyes around.  Don't look in the mirror or you'll ID yourself.  OK?  You got a half hour of tape, so give me some lead-in to the main event.  But don't wait too long, I don't want to be going out for popcorn.  And don't act natural.  Don't act at all. Just forget the thing is on.  Got it?

turns.speaker: EDUARDO
turns.text: No problem.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: A star is born.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: We have nothing to talk about, Lenny.

turns.speaker: TRAN
turns.text: Joey, make sure Mr. Nero gets safely to his car.

turns.speaker: TRAN
turns.text: Lenny the loser.  Panhandler of stolen dreams.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Leave him alone, Tran.

turns.speaker: TRAN
turns.text: He's no concern of mine, as long as you don't talk to him.  Don't talk to anybody.  You understand?  Not with everything that's going on right now.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: You're too goddamned paranoid.

turns.speaker: TRAN
turns.text: Paranoia's only reality on a finer scale.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Look, Tran... Lenny just came by to give me some bad news.  An old friend of mine has been murdered. You remember Iris?

turns.speaker: TRAN
turns.text: A tragic story, no doubt.  How'd you get up here?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I made my choice, Lenny.

turns.speaker: TRAN
turns.text: You're going down.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: You said you were going to get her out of this.

turns.speaker: TRAN
turns.text: Maybe now you appreciate the danger we're in.  It was touching the way you stood by me in there.  "Stand by your man". I was moved.  You were very good.  I don't think he even understands that you did it for him.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: He doesn't know what's going on. Leave him alone.

turns.speaker: TRAN
turns.text: I'd love to.  But he keeps showing up.  And you keep talking to him.  I can't have that--

turns.speaker: TRAN
turns.text: The only time a whore should open her mouth is when she's giving head.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Fuck you.

turns.speaker: TRAN
turns.text: Maybe later.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Well, I'm certainly in the mood for a party.

turns.speaker: TRAN
turns.text: Take her up to the suite.  Have a glass of champagne... or six... I'll be up in a while to help you ring in the New Year.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I live for the moment.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: This piece of puke hired me to kill you, baby.  Do you believe that? Isn't that right, Tran?  You pinhead.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Oh my God.  I don't believe this is happening.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Believe it.  Now bring me the trodes, baby.  Come on, quick.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: What're you going to do?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: You can't just... kill him.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'm not.  Just a little poach job.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Jesus.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Hey, he was going to kill you.  And this ratfuck paid to have Iris killed, to save his own sorry ass.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Look, baby, it's now of never... the guy is a known input junkie, so a little OD won't surprise anybody. It's the only way we can be together.  You know it's true.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: My God.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You were supposed to go downstairs, baby.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I know.  I don't always do exactly what I'm told.  So I said, 'Do you enjoy watching me?'  And you said -- come on Max.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I said, 'Yeah.  I'd even do it for free.'

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Uh huh.  And I said, 'That's good, because I like the feeling of someone watching me.  I acquired the taste from Lenny.'

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: And then she said, 'Since we're going to be spending so much time together--'

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: 'We might as well make the best of it.'

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Hey, you going to watch or you going to do?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Watch and see.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I feel like you're turning me into a VCR.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: I just want to see what we're like together through your eyes.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I don't feel anything.  Is it on?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Forget it's there.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Make me forget it, baby.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Cut it out, Tran.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Too bad about your guy Jeriko. Tough break.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I don't think that's a good idea, Lenny.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: I just got to talk to you for one second.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Faith, call me, okay?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: No, Lenny.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Hi, baby.  I've missed you.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I know.  Lenny, if Tran finds you talking to me he'll hurt you.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: I'm already hurting.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: You have to go.  I mean it.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Yeah, OK, whatever you say.  Just answer one question.  Is anything wrong?  Iris said you might be in trouble.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: You talked to Iris?  When?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Tonight.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Well I haven't seen her in months. Who knows what's going on in her head.  You're really running out of excuses to come around, aren't you?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: I know you Faith.  You're afraid of something.  What's going on?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Let it alone, Lenny.  It'll take care of itself.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: It's Tran, isn't it?  This guy is poison, Faith.  Listen to me.  He's got you walled in on all sides.  And he uses the wire too much, he gets off on tape, not on you.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: That's a good one, coming from you.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Why don't you just split?  You don't love him, anybody can see that.  And to him you're just some kinda possession, like a Ferrari, something to show the other guys.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: He has his uses too.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: What?  He gonna record you on his label?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Come on, Faith!  He's just toying with you.  And when he gets bored, you'll be yesterday's papers.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Look, baby, I've watched you create yourself out of nothing.  You're like a goddamn cruise missile, targeted on making it.  And you will.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Damn right.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: It's you up on that stage, not him. You don't need him.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: You have to get out of here.  If Tran catches you he'll... he's acting crazy.  He's doing way too much playback and he's getting completely paranoid.  He's such a control freak, he's even paying Max to follow me around.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Max Pelcher?  You're kidding?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Yeah, for about a month now.  Lenny, just stay away from Tran, okay?  And stay away from me.  Stop trying to rescue me.  Those days are over. I'm a big girl now.  Stop trying to save me, okay, because I don't need saving... Just... give up on me.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Can't do it.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: You know one of the ways movies still have Squid beat?  Because they always say "The End." You always know when it's over.  It's over! Now please leave.  I have to go on again in a couple of minutes.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: You're crazier than I thought, Lenny.  Coming here... Tran's just in there.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Iris is dead.  She was murdered.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Who did it?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Don't know.  But this guy's real damaged goods.  Iris knew someone was after her... and she said you were in danger too.  Now no more games, Faith.  Whatever you're hiding, whatever's going on, you have to get out of here now. Come with me right now.  Don't even think about it.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Then what?  Then what, Lenny?!  You going to protect me?  Big tough guy. You're a talker, Lenny.  You don't even have a gun.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: I have a gun.  It's under my bed.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: You don't know what you're fucking with here.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Tell me.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Faith, we know about Jeriko.  Iris made me a copy of the tape.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Oh God, Lenny.  I was trying to keep you out of this.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: How did it happen?  What was Iris doing riding around with Jeriko wearing a wire?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: We should talk alone.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: No.  Mace is in this.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: So finally he gives Iris some cash and tells her to check into the hotel under a wrong name till he figures out what to do.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Yeah... he figured out what to do all right.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: You think Tran killed her?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: The killer knew right where she was. Because he put her there.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: What a nightmare.

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: I understand.  No, I'm not.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: You understand?  Attorney!  Right? Am I right?

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: A virgin brain!  Well we're going to start you off right.  So what do you know about this?  Save us some time...

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Just what I've read.  That the technology was developed for the Feds, to replace the body wire.  And now it's gone black market.  So, uh, do I get the deck from you?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: I'll set you up, get you a deck at my cost... since my thing is the software.

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Clips.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: That's right.  Clips.  Look, I want you to know what we're talking about here.  This isn't like TV only better.  This is life.  It's a piece of somebody's life.  Pure and uncut, straight from the cerebral cortex.  You're there. You're doing it, seeing it, hearing it... feeling it.

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: What kind of things exactly?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Exactly anything.  Whatever you want.  Whoever you want to be.  Fabri, get us another round, would you.

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Sounds good.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: I can get you what you want.  You just have to talk to me.  I'm your priest, your shrink, your main connection to the switchboard of souls.  I'm the Magic Man, the Santa Claus of the Subconscious.  You say it, you even think it, you can have it.  You want a girl, you want two girls?  I don't know what your thing is or what you're curious about... you want a guy?  You want to be a girl... see what that feels like? You want a nun to tie you up?  It's all doable.

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Talk to me about costs, here.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Listen, before we get into numbers, I want you to try a taste.  I got a deck with me.

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: What?  Right Here?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Step into my office.

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Yeah, I'm interested, but can we get someplace a little less public?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: You nervous?  Forget it.  The cops have more to worry about in this city than the squid-trade, believe me--

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You see the look on that preppy puke's face?  Fuckin' pissed in his Topsiders.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Okay.  It was funny.  But it cost me money.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Come on, amigo, the world's full of marks.  And nobody knows how to work 'em like you do, pal.  You could sell a goddamn rat's asshole for a wedding ring!  Let me buy you a drink.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Least you can do.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Bobbyyyy!  Tequila por favor! Double shots.  Make it Tres Generaciones, huh.  Nothin' but the best for my good friend Lenny, the finest cop that ever got thrown off the vice squad.  Hey, nice tie.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Thanks, Max.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: D'you always have to dress like a fuckin' pimp?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: This tie cost more than your entire wardrobe.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: That's not sayin' much.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: It's the one thing that stands between me and the jungle.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: You were lucky, Max.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yup.  So darn lucky.  I wake up with a .22-short floating in my brainpan, and a cop pension I can't live off of.  Good thing I wasn't any luckier.  Bobby!  Another shooter right here!

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Naw.  She won't call me.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Just as well, Lenny.  You gotta get past it.  I mean sure, Faith was by far the most outstanding woman a guy like you could ever hope to get, I mean it's completely and deeply humiliating that she's gone, but it's over, campadre.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Thanks, Max.  I'm touched by your concern.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I just hate to see you pining away. It makes me want to vomit, frankly.  Broken hearts are for assholes.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Hey, Iris, you okay?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: See, if you packed your piece you could've made the guy see sense.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Uh unh, carrying a gun wrecks the line of a fine jacket.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: An ex-cop that doesn't carry.  It's embarrassing.  I oughta not be seen with you.  Hey, Mace.  What's goin' on?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'm telling ya, it's over.  We used it all up--

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Shutup a second!

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Shoulda told me about your new gig, buddy.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I was gonna tell ya.  Hey, it's just a job.  I feel like shit about it.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: You should feel like shit.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I figured, what the hell, I could take the prick's money and make sure Faith was OK at the same time.  Do us both good.  Right?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Fairly twisted logic, Max, even for you.  Hey, at least you got a job!  Watch her for me.  Stay on her.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'm on her.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You alright?  Y'okay?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Yeah.  No, not really.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Let's work it.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Not now... I don't want to think about it--

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Come on, Lenny.  You used to be good at this stuff.  Play it down. What's the perp doing?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: He stalks her.  He rapes her.  Then he does her...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: And he records it.  Thrill kill. Wants to see it again.  And again.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: He records himself raping and killing her--

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: But at the same time he's sending the signal to her--

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: So she feels... what he feels... while he's in her.  The thrill while he's killing her... is sent to her, heightening her fear... which in turn heightens the turn on for him.  I've seen a lot, Max.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: So've I.  Too much.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: But this is a bad one.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Top ten.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: He makes her see her own death, feeds off the reaction... killer and victim merging... orgasm and agony merging.  And he records it all.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: That's right.  He wants to share. Needs an audience.  This is one sick puppy.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Why me?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Hey, the last day of the world and you spend it in bed.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: W'sup, Max?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Faith OK?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yeah.  She's leaving with Tran so I got to boogie.  Real quick... Iris checked into the Sheraton last night under a false name.  Paid cash.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Looks like she was holding out.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yup.  Hey, so I heard you dropped in on Tran last night.  Another slick Lenny move.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: He's in this somehow... I don't know how.  Just stay close to Faith.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'm on her, amigo.  No worries. Gotta jam.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Sounds like Tick's already celebrating.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: You may be a little overdressed for this party.  Yo, Tick!  It's Lenny.  Open up!

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: He's been cooked-off

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Is he dead?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: No.  But his frontal lobes are like two runny eggs.  They put an amplifier in-line to boost the signal till it french-fried his brain.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Whattya mean?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: All I'm saying... you don't know how high up the food chain this thing goes.  I've heard stuff.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: What stuff?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Smoke.  Rumors.  I've heard stuff about a death squad.  A group a guys loyal to the hardline school.  Guys that've had too many years of city hall and the review boards and the goddamn media pissing down their necks, suspending cops right and left, tying their hands... while outa the other side a their mouths these same people're squealing save us, save us, do something you fucking morons, crime is totally out of control.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Jesus.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yeah.  So don't walk near me in public, alright.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Thanks, buddy.  See... things weren't bad enough.  They weren't fucking bad enough!
